Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.controller

Class ConcreteInputMediator

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.controller.ConcreteInputMediator
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputMediator
public final class ConcreteInputMediator extends Object implements InputMediator

Central class connecting the application's 'model' and 'view' levels in terms of user-input.

Allows keeping the model independent from the view, for a Model-View-Controller approach.

In charge of gathering user-input from one of the concurrent views.

Works with semaphore-inspired latches. This class can send input requests to all known views and sleep itself until it receives valid input from a view. When a stranger class sends an input request through an instance of this class, it will also put itself on hold until valid input is received.

The following classes use this class to send their input requests through a class implementing InputMediator, specifying each type of input to be collected : classes of the controller.core package, HumanPlayer, Tabletop and StdPlayerCreator.

The following classes are sources of input for this class : most classes of the controller.interactions package and InterruptibleStdInput. See InputSource, the interface implemented by user-input-gathering view classes.

This class is also responsible for interrupting input collect on all concurrent views once a first response is received.

Knows the central class of each concurrent view (StdView and GUIView). Also knows InterruptibleStdInput.

The main input mediator is instantiated by Application.

See Also:
  • Classes of the model package can put themselves on hold, awaiting for user-input, by calling a public method on an InputMediator.
  • HumanPlayer
  • PlayerInputRequester
  • Tabletop
  • User input in the main menu is also collected this way.
  • StdPlayerCreator uses a slave input mediator to collect input
  • InputSource is implemented by each class able to send collected input to an InputMediator.
  • InterruptibleStdInput is a non-blocking console input collector
  • StdPlayerCreator sends to a master input mediator its created players
  • Classes of the controller.interactions package that implement InputSource post collected input to an input mediator.
  • The view is updated when asking for input and when receiving invalid or valid input.
  • StdView, the central class of the Console view. Used for displaying error messages and prompts.
  • GUIView, the central class of the Graphical User Interface. Display-update directives are sent once input is received.
  • Stranger classes send their display requests through an instance of a class implementing DisplayMediator
  • User-input is gathered from the view by another component, the InputMediator

  • Method Details

    • makeChoice

      public int makeChoice(Menu m)

      Requests the View to get an input from the user corresponding to a choice of the given Menu

      Only calls for input and display error messages concerning that input

      The display of the menu itselfs is achieved by a class implementing DisplayMediator

      Calls itselfs recursively until valid input is gathered. Once valid input is received, the GUI is updated and the chosen option is logged into the console.
      Specified by:
      makeChoice in interface InputMediator
      Parameters:
      m - An instance of Menu, with a given title and given options
      Returns:
      A positive int corresponding to the position of the selected option in the given Menu's array of choices.

    • answerYesNoQuestion

      public boolean answerYesNoQuestion() throws InterruptedException
      Answers a yes-no question based on user-input. Console only.
      Specified by:
      answerYesNoQuestion in interface InputMediator
      Returns:
      true if the user has chosen "yes", false if they have chosen "no".
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • wannaContinue

      public void wannaContinue()
      Asks for user-input from the view before continuing further.
      Specified by:
      wannaContinue in interface InputMediator

    • createPlayer

      public Player createPlayer(int id, List<String> chosenNames, boolean optionnal)

      Requests the View to gather information from user-input in order to create a player to add to the game.

      Input can be sent by StdCreator, which uses another instance of this class for creating a player based on standard input, and sends its created players to this one.

      Input can also be sent by PlayerCreatorController, which creates players based on the input gathered by the graphical user interface.

      The first InputSource to send a Player rules over all others, which are interrupted. Called by Tabletop to instantiate a Player into the game.

      Specified by:
      createPlayer in interface InputMediator
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the player that is to be created.
      chosenNames - The list of all already taken player names.
      optionnal - true if the minimum number of players has already been reached.
      Returns:
      The player, created on the basis of the information gathered from user-input
      See Also:
      • getPlayerInput()
      • receive(Player)

    • createPlayer

      public Player createPlayer(int id, String name, boolean isHuman)

      Lets the input mediator create a player with the given parameters and become this new player's input mediator.

      Specified by:
      createPlayer in interface InputMediator
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the player that is to be created.
      name - The new player's name
      isHuman - true if the player is human-controlled
      Returns:
      The player, created on the basis of the information gathered from user-input
      See Also:
      • Player

    • getStdInput

      public void getStdInput() throws InterruptedException
      Instantiates an InterruptibleStdInput in its own thread in order to gather user-input from the console non-blockingly. Awaits for an answer by decrementing a semaphore.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
      See Also:
      • interruptStdInput()

    • getStringInput

      public String getStringInput() throws InterruptedException

      Puts this class on the hold until it receives a String, then returns it.

      Can be called by foreign classes when used as a slave input mediator for building a result step by step based on plural sequential answers. (see StdPlayerCreator).

      return #receivedString once it is nonempty.
      Specified by:
      getStringInput in interface InputMediator
      Returns:
      The received string.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • getIntInput

      private int getIntInput()

      Puts this class on the hold until it receives an integer, then returns it.

      Returns:
      receivedString parsed as an integer. -1 if parsing failed.
      See Also:
      • Calls getStringInput()
